text: Dame Temuranga Batley-Jackson (24 August 1939 – 28 March 2022), known as June Jackson, was a New Zealand Māori activist and public servant. She was chief executive officer of the Manukau Urban Māori Authority from 1986 to 2009, and a member of the New Zealand Parole Board from 1991 until her death. Jackson died on 28 March 2022 at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Māori rights activists
title: June Jackson
